a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Expected years of schooling vs. share in extreme poverty, 2022
Expected years of schooling is the number of years a child of school entrance age can expect to receive if the
current age-specific enrollment rates persist throughout the childâ€™s years of schooling. Extreme poverty is defined
as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
Data source: UNDP, Human Development Report (2024); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2023)

Note: Poverty data is expressed in
international-$
at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured
after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita .
